prompt: <description>**Part 1: Rectangular Prism with Cylindrical Hole** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. Now create the 2D sketch for this part on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. In this sketch, you will create a rectangle and a cylindrical hole inside this rectangle. 1. **Rectangle**: Create a new face, face_1, for the 2D sketch. - Start Point: [0.0, 0.0], End Point: [0.75, 0.0] - Start Point: [0.75, 0.0], End Point: [0.75, 0.625] - Start Point: [0.75, 0.625], End Point: [0.0, 0.625] - Start Point: [0.0, 0.625], End Point: [0.0, 0.0] 2. **Cylindrical Hole**: Create another loop, loop_2, for the 2D sketch on the same face (face_1). - Center: [0.3906, 0.3125], Radius: 0.0781 (This creates a circle for the cylindrical hole) Your 2D sketch should now have two loops: one for the rectangle and another for the cylindrical hole. Next, scale the 2D sketch uniformly by a factor of 0.75 (sketch_scale parameter) to adjust the dimensions according to the description. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system created earlier. Now, extract the 3D model by extruding the 2D sketch along the normal vector with an extrusion depth of 0.0625 units (extrude_depth_towards_normal), resulting in a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole. The height, width, and length of this part are given below: - Height: 0.75 units - Width: 0.0625 units - Length: 0.75 units This completes the instructions for Part 1. Follow the same process for subsequent parts as needed. Remember to use the appropriate Euler angles, translation vectors, and scaling factors provided in the JSON.</description>
